Subject: Physics
Topics: Revision /concept of electricity: electric current,  potential difference and electromotive force, resistance and their units Ohm’s law and its verification  conductors that do not obey Ohm’s lawK

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson students should be able to: I]differentiate between electric current potential difference electromotive force and resistance ii]  State Ohm’s law and explain its verification, iii] distinguish between Ohmic  conductors with examples iv] perform an experiment to establish the relationship between V and 1

Learning Activities.value: I] the students in small groups  are provided with battery, rheostat , connecting wires, ammeter etc to verify the Ohm’s law experimentally ii] K  students go online  for more info on the ih m’s law

Embedded Core Skills.value: critical thinking & problem solving Ii] communication & collaboration Iii] leadership & personal development iv. Digital literacy

Learning Resources.value: A. Audio visual resources (i] connecting wires Ii] ammeter voltmeter Galvanometer and multimeter Iii] battery Iv] Rheostat V] bulb   B Web Resources

Subject: Physics
Topics: Resistors in series and parallel, cells in series, and parallel, calculations. Resistivity and conductivity Factors affecting the electrical resistance of a conductor

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson students should be able to: (i] draw simple electric circle to distinguish between series and paralled connections Ii] solve simple questions  on series and parallel connections Iii] distinguish between resistivity and conductivity Iv] investigate the factors affecting the electrical resistance of a conductor

Learning Activities.value: I] the students in small groups are provided with resistors, cells and connecting wires to demonstrate series and parallel connection of resistors of resistors as well as of cells Ii] The students go online for more info on resistivity and conductivity

Embedded Core Skills.value: critical thinking & problem solving Ii] communication & collaboration Iii] leadership & personal development iv. Digital literacy

Learning Resources.value: A. Audio visual resources I] connecting wires Ii] metals of different conductivity Iii] cells/ batter B web resources

Subject: Physics
Topics: Electric energy and power, buying electric current, safety devices and detecting faults in current

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson students should be able to: (i] deduce the formula of electrical energy and power Ii] solve simple; problems using the deduced formula; Iii] investigate the commercial unit of electrical energy Iv] solve simple problems on buying /cost

Learning Activities.value: I] the students as a class discuss the electricity safety devices Ii] the students in small groups demonstrate the application of switches and fuses Iii] The students go online for more info on electric energy

Embedded Core Skills.value: critical thinking & problem solving Ii] communication & collaboration Iii] leadership & personal development iv. Digital literacy

Learning Resources.value: A Audio visual resources I] electric bills Ii] fuse Iii] switch Iv] wire V] bulb B Web Resources

Subject: Physics
Topics: Electricity: Hooke’s law, Tensile stress, Tensile strain and young modules

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson students should be able to: (i] analyse the term electricity (ii] State Hooke’s law Iii] distinguish between the following terms [a] elastic Limited (b) yield point (c) breaking point (d) maximum load )e) tensile strain and tensile train and tensile stress (f) young module (iv) differentiate between tensile strain and tensile stress v] perform an experiment to establish the relationship between force F and extension e

Learning Activities.value: I] The students are provided with spiral spring, metal masses and retort stand to verify the Hook’s law experimentally Ii] The students as a class compare tensile stress and tensile strain Iii] The students go online for more info on Hooke’s law to verify the Hook’s law

Embedded Core Skills.value: critical thinking & problem solving Ii] communication & collaboration Iii] leadership & personal development iv. Digital literacy

Learning Resources.value: A Audio visual resources I] spring balance Ii] slotted weight /masses Iii] spiral spring Iv] retort stand Vi] stop watch Vii] plasticine /chewing gum Viii] coloured marker B web resources

Subject: Physics
Topics: Energy in Elastic materials and calculations

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson students should be able to: (i) device formula for calculating energy stored in elastic material; Ii] use the derived formula to solve simple calculations

Learning Activities.value: I] the students as a class discuss the energy in elastic materials Ii] the students go online for more info on energy in elastic materials

Embedded Core Skills.value: critical thinking & problem solving Ii] communication & collaboration Iii] leadership & personal development iv. Digital literacy

Learning Resources.value: A audio visual Resources Calculator B. web resource

Learning Activities.value: The students as a class do revision on all the practical done so far
The students in small groups design circuit comprising of resistors and cells in series and in parallel

Embedded Core Skills.value: critical thinking & problem solving Ii] communication & collaboration Iii] leadership & personal development
